comment: Very easy to get an A if you just show up. There's 3 tests you get graded on plus an optional final that can be used to replace one of the other 3 test grades. You are allowed to bring a cheat sheet with anything on it, and before each exam he goes over what will exactly be on the exam and gives you exam copies from previous years to practice.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: This is a hard class generally, but I loved the way he did his best to teach it in the most simplified way. He is definitely old school; you're going to have to go to class to learn the material and get the notes but as long as you do that, you'll be good. He ended up rounding my entire grade up a letter bc I came to class and tried my best

Grades out of 3 test and an optional final. Just hands out printed notes and doesn't teach anything. Consistently goes off topic and talks about when he was "30 years old living in a frat house". Seems like a cool guy out of the class but don't take him if you're trying to pass this class. You'll end up teaching yourself.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He's good if you're looking for an easy A and not to actually learn anything. Whole class is 3 tests made up entirely of formulas, which he gives a formula sheet for. He doesn't post anything on D2L so class attendance is essential.

This class was a lot easier than expected. Although attendance isn't mandatory I would highly recommend going because nothing he does is online. It's all paper handouts. But the handouts are extremely helpful and the tests are EXACTLY like the practice ones. The final grade is the avg. of 3 tests- not including the optional final.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: took him for the summer, not a bad class. He gives you a full cheat sheet with every formula that will be on the test that you can fill out however you want. Honestly it was a pretty easy class in my opinion, the only things i did was go to class and understand my cheat sheet before the tests

This class was based on 3 exams excluding the final. If you want an A in the class, your 3 exams need to equal 270 points. If you like your grade after the 3 exams, you do not have to sit for the final. He does not use D2L and he hands out paper notes IN CLASS!!! If you do not go to class, you will fail. Allows a cheat sheet on the exams.

I had to teach myself the whole course. Any questions I brought to him, it was like he didn't comprehend what I was asking or just wasn't able to break it down in a way I understood. Make your study guides, and get with a friend; if you have to ask him something, ask for the answer and work it backward yourself. DO NOT TAKE HIM IF YOU CAN.

He is very straightforward about what is going to be in the exam. He would summarize what you need to know in handouts, and the "old test" is a very useful source to learn. Even though he does not use D2L at all, as long as you show up to classes frequently, you will 100% keep up with class and get an easy A.

We were only graded on a few tests which he allows a full cheat sheet on. He doesn't post anything online, so make sure you go to class to get the handouts that have every formula you will need along with very clear examples. These will be a lifesaver for the tests. He explains all the examples very well and encourages questions. I loved his class!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: If you like classes that are spoon fed to you, this is it. I took him during a summer semester and he gave us many handouts that had exactly what the tests had. He allows a full paper cheat sheet front and back as well as using the FV & PV tables. He made this class so easy for a finance class. Only downside is he only does in person paper tests.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Easy class. Gave you the equation you just needed to take the time to understand. Cheat sheet front and back. Only reason I received a C was because of some personal reasons, nothing on the professor. He is funny and class and will answer any questions.

Prof. Kochman himself isn't a bad person. His teaching style just didn't sit well with me. He really only taught us formulas and how to plug stuff into them to get answers. I always left this class feeling like I learned nothing. He is also strictly pen and paper. He does not use d2l. Wouldn't recommend if you actually care about learning stuff.

Prof Kochman is old school, he does not use D2L. While attendance is not mandatory, you have to attend class if you want to pass. There are 3 unit test and 1 cumulative. Only the three highest will count towards you final grade. To succeed try to cram as much of the handouts and pretest in your cheat, also skimming the chapters will help. Later.

This class is hard and top of that test are heavy. Only 3 test 33.3% and don't miss class if you take him. You will be lost next class. Don't fall behind and practice problems at home only helpfully thing is the note card at test.

Ignore the bad reviews, Prof Kochman is a sweet professor who genuinely wants us to do well in his class. He admits the material is hard so he allows us to write a cheat sheet for the test and explains things slowly. I would definitely take this class again.

this is a class you dont want to skip because he rarely goes back to talk about something if you werent there. he states what will be on the test and goes over past tests. Since you create your own cheat sheet its up to you on how well you do on tests. I got over 100 on every test because its just like the examples he does
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: there is no homework which sucks because its hard to retain lectures, he is all over the place and notes suck. there are three tests and optional final. but his tests are hard. i stopped showing up to class because i learned nothing and had to teach myself. he gives insider notes of whats on the test so get those and teach yourself

comment: You are graded by the 3 highest test grades. If you like the average of the first 3 you don't have to take the final. I was worried at first, but he was a good teacher. He passed out handouts with formulas for each test and went over how to use the formulas. You get a sheet of paper front and back full of notes for the test. 1st test is harder

comment: Hes hilarious. He is very old fashioned, you get lots of handouts. His lectures are hard to follow at first, but you get used to them. Get the same edition textbook as him. He says you dont need to, but I highly suggest it. No hw, only 3 tests & 1 final. You get 1 page of notes on all. I truly learned nothing in this course, but I did pass.

comment: Decent guy but I feel like I didn't learn what I will need in future finance classes. Graded by 3/4 tests, you can drop a test & a 65 is a C but an A is NOT easy. The notes he gave out and his lectures seemed to drop in quality after the first test and after BOMBING the second test I had to teach myself everything afterwards. Take at your own risk
